Definition.WordDefinition:
flashback \flashback\ n. 1. a transition (in literary or theatrical works or films) to an earlier event or scene; also, the scene thus introduced. [WordNet 1.5]
2. An unusually vivid recollection of a prior experience, often one that is traumatic, such as scenes from combat or a criminal assault, or induced by hallucinogenic drugs such as LSD; when accompanied by hallucinations it is called flashback hallucinosis. [PJC]
flash back v : return in time; "the film cut back to an earlier event in the story" [syn: {cut back}]

flashback n 1: a transition (in literary or theatrical works or films) to an earlier event or scene that interrupts the normal chronological development of the story [ant: {flash-forward}] 2: an unexpected but vivid recurrence of a past experience (especially a recurrence of the effects of an hallucinogenic drug taken much earlier)
